title: Hamas says October 7 attacks 'necessary step' but admits to 'faults'
summary: The Palestinian group issued a public report explaining its motivations for the October 7 and calling for an 'immediate halt of the Israeli aggression.' Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he rejected the conditions demanded for the release of hostages.

title: Israeli society, deaf to Palestinian suffering, faces enduring collective trauma
summary: The vast majority of Israelis believe that the war was made necessary when Hamas massacred 1,200 civilians and soldiers. As their trauma endures, they ignore the deadly consequences of the military operations in the Palestinian enclave.

title: Ron Desantis drops out of Republican presidential race and endorses Trump
summary: The Florida governor announced his decision to end his White House bid in a video published Sunday evening, less than two days before the New Hampshire primary

title: India: Modi launches his campaign by weaponizing Hinduism
summary: The nationalist prime minister has utilized the construction of the Rama temple, built on the site of a former mosque that was illegally destroyed by Hindus, as his springboard for a third term in the upcoming general elections this spring.

title: Germany: 1.4 million marched against far right over week-end, say organizers
summary: Demonstrations were held following revelations the far-right AfD party discussed mass deportation plans. The protest in Munich had to be called off after attendance by far exceeded organizers' expectations.

title: 'Champagne has lost a few bubbles'
summary: The number of bottles sold in 2023 fell just below the 300 million mark, to 299 million, a year-on-year decline of 8.2%, observes economics journalist Laurence Girard.

title: French immigration bill: Thousands march against restrictive law's enactment
summary: Around 16,000 people marched in Paris on Sunday, according to French police, and 75,000 nationally, to protest against the immigration law recently adopted by Parliament.

title: AFCON 2024: Morocco held by DR Congo in heated match
summary: In another Group F match, Tanzania couldn't secure its first win under new coach Hemed Suleiman, as Zambia, reduced to 10 men, rallied to a 1-1 draw. Meanwhile, South Africa reignited its campaign with a decisive 4-0 victory over neighboring Namibia.

title: 'Femicide' in Le Monde: A term that has sadly become commonplace
summary: Justice Minister Eric Dupond-Moretti and women's organizations disagree over the number of women in France killed in 2023. When Le Monde first used the term 'femicide' 20 years earlier, it was in reference to the lives of women in Mexico.

title: Israel: Deep rifts in war cabinet begin to show
summary: Minister Gadi Eisenkot said only a deal would ensure hostages in Gaza could be freed, while calling for legislative elections, in a blow to Prime Minister Netanyahu.

title: After maternity leave, the difficult return to work: 'Oh, it's today you're coming back?'
summary: Juggling the stress of leaving their child behind, dealing with a new organizational arrangement and sometimes an unprepared employer, returning to work is still a tricky time for mothers, despite some progress in the professional sphere in acknowledging motherhood.

title: Monaco scrambles to avoid appearing on money laundering 'grey list'
summary: Monaco has adopted a series of fast-track reforms to make up for its anti-money laundering system which was deemed inadequate.

title: Ian Bailey, man convicted of murder in France, dies in Ireland
summary: The British journalist was convicted in absentia by a Paris court of the 1996 murder of Sophie Toscan du Plantier, but Ireland refused to extradite him.

title: Fishing ban comes into effect to protect dolphins in Bay of Biscay
summary: A four-week ban on trawlers operating along France's western coastline comes into effect on January 22 at midnight, affecting around 450 vessels. Fishermen have complained about the loss of income caused by the government's decision.

title: Strike on busy market kills 25 in Russian-occupied Donetsk
summary: Moscow-backed officials said the strike hit a southwestern suburb of the city. Le Monde was not able to immediately verify the circumstances of the attack.

title: At Olympique Lyonnais, a nationalist atmosphere persists in the stands
summary: In both of OL's kops, a far-right minority has marked its territory. Some feel confident enough to express their racism, openly or more covertly, especially during away matches.

title: Europe faces a wave of Chinese cars
summary: The European car market is recovering from its post-Covid slump, but progress is stalling. Rising car prices are clashing with consumer spending power, and the growing dominance of Chinese manufacturers is dampening prospects.

title: AI dominates Davos as business leaders turn to new tech
summary: Artificial intelligence, with its promise of spectacular increases in labor productivity, was at the heart of discussions at the World Economic Forum in Davos, including French start-up Mistral.
